channel.title: Question concering the current version and the steam version
channel.description:
Hey guys
I just completed the current version of Black Mesa for the second time. Now, I was wondering when the steam version finally releases, will my progress and achievements cross over to that version. Or do I need to replay the whole game again en get my achievenements a second time?
Cheers!

item.title: Question concering the current version and the steam version
item.dc:creator: jadebenn
item.description:
RKORTON:

Cheers Hubicorn.

No matter, I’ll replay the game for a 3rd time. It’s a well done project after all!

If you want to jump ahead anyway, I believe you can unlock the menu options for the chapters by typing in “sv_unlockedchapters 15” (though I have no idea if this will work on their version of the engine).

Read full topic
item.source: Question concering the current version and the steam version

item.title: Question concering the current version and the steam version
item.dc:creator: Hubicorn
item.description:
Ideally, but who’s to say you cant get away with loading from your save data? Just listing possible causes of why it might go wrong if it does.

Read full topic
item.source: Question concering the current version and the steam version

item.title: Question concering the current version and the steam version
item.dc:creator: RKORTON
item.description:
So basically in order to run it properly, I need to replay the game.

Read full topic
item.source: Question concering the current version and the steam version

item.title: Question concering the current version and the steam version
item.dc:creator: Hubicorn
item.description:
Achievements won’t be able to transfer over. Now game save data is a bit tricky. The save files are totally backwards compatible, however it might cause some unexpected results or possibly crashes in some cases. A few reasons this could occur would be:

  • That area of the map on the save file has been altered compared to the retail build.
  • Certain cached settings on the save file for that map has been altered and no longer valid on the retail version causing unexpected playback results.
    However, there are commands that you can enter in the console~ that will allow you to unlock chapters.

Read full topic
item.source: Question concering the current version and the steam version

item.title: Question concering the current version and the steam version
item.dc:creator: Dotard
item.description:
Your save should work, albeit with some bugs possibly present. Your achievements won’t transfer over.

Read full topic
